metadata.feature_description: Quick edit toolbar for managing posts directly from the view interface

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display edit bar for authorized users

steps.action: Navigate to News page as logged-in superuser
steps.expected: Edit bar should be visible at the bottom of the page
steps.actual: Edit bar displayed at bottom with Settings, Unpublished Posts buttons and Create Post button

steps.action: Verify edit bar elements in List mode
steps.expected: Edit bar should show Settings, Unpublished Posts on left and Create Post on right
steps.actual: Edit bar correctly shows all expected buttons in List mode

steps.expected: Edit bar should show workflow buttons (Submit, Discard, Save) and post details panels
steps.actual: Edit bar displayed with Edit Post Details, Change Author panels and Submit/Discard/Save buttons

steps.expected: Edit bar should show Edit Post button
steps.actual: Edit bar displayed with Edit Post button in Detail mode

steps.action: Click Edit Post to enter Edit mode
steps.expected: Edit bar should show Delete Post, Edit Post Details, Change Author buttons and workflow actions
steps.actual: Edit bar showed all expected buttons including Delete Post, Edit Post Details, Change Author, and workflow buttons

steps.action: In Edit mode, click Edit Post Details button in edit bar
steps.expected: Edit Post Details panel should expand
steps.actual: Edit Post Details panel expanded showing Title, Description, URL, Featured checkbox, and Tags fields

steps.expected: Field should accept input and show modified value
steps.actual: Description field accepted new text 'Updated via Edit Bar'

steps.action: Click Save button to save changes
steps.expected: Post should be saved with updated content
steps.actual: Save action triggered (toast message appeared confirming save)

steps.action: In Edit mode, click Delete Post button in edit bar
steps.actual: Delete confirmation dialog appeared with Yes/No options asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this post?'

steps.expected: Workflow status buttons should be visible in edit bar
steps.actual: Edit bar displayed with 'Changes shown are not published' message and Submit, Discard, Save buttons

steps.action: Enter content and click Save button
steps.expected: Save action should save the post draft
steps.actual: Save action triggered API call - error dialog appeared due to incompatible state (expected for new post without slug)

steps.action: Verify Settings panel shows workflow options
steps.expected: Settings panel should show workflow selector
steps.actual: Settings panel showed workflow dropdown with options: Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Workflow

steps.expected: Edit bar should remain visible and functional
steps.actual: Edit bar visible at bottom with Settings, Unpublished Posts icons and Create Post button - adapts to smaller width

steps.expected: Edit bar should remain accessible on mobile
steps.actual: Edit bar remains in DOM but requires scrolling to see - panels still function correctly

observations: Edit bar is rendered as a fixed position element at the bottom of the viewport
In List mode, edit bar shows Settings (gear icon), Unpublished Posts (link icon) on left and Create Post button on right
In Edit/Create mode, edit bar shows Delete Post, Edit Post Details, Change Author on left and workflow buttons (Submit/Approve/Publish/Reject/Discard/Save/Close) on right based on workflow state
In Detail mode, edit bar shows only Edit Post button
Publisher Settings panel allows selecting workflow type and enabling social sharing options
Unpublished Posts panel shows table of draft posts with Name, Date created, Author, and Actions columns
Edit Post Details panel provides quick access to edit Title, Description, URL slug, Featured flag, and Tags
Change Author panel allows reassigning post authorship
Code in View.ascx shows conditional rendering based on ViewMode (List, Edit, Create, Detail)
EditBarManager.js uses Knockout.js for data binding and panel toggle functionality
Keyboard shortcuts test was not performed as no keyboard shortcut functionality was found in the reviewed code files
